name: Overview
main:
Protracted armed conflict between ethnic groups and the government means over 525,500 people are in continued need of assistance, primarily in Kachin,  Rakhine states.?? Access to populations in need  in these states is constrained. There is active conflict primarily in Kachin, Shan and Rakhine states. .?

In Rakhine state, discrimination against the Rohingya Muslim minority has caused protracted displacement. IDPs in Rakhine have limited access to services and are confined to camps. Since October 2016, tensions between the Rohingya and the Myanmar Army have escalated and access has deteriorated further.?

INFORM measures Myanmar's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster at 6.7/10. Hazard and exposure, as well as lack of coping capacity, and vulnerability are at 7.5/10, 6/10 and 6.6/10 respectively.?
latest_developments_past:
12/06: 1,477 cases of dengue have been recorded in the first quarter of 2017, including eight fatalities, compared to 280 cases including four fatalities for the whole of 2016.??

12/06:  950 people are displaced in Tanai township, Kachin state, since fighting between the Myanmar Army and the Kachin Independence Army (KIA) broke out on 3 June. The displaced are sheltering in churches and monasteries in the area.??
